text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service

This transmits revised IRM 1.4.24, Resource Guide for Managers - Central Withholding Agreement Program Group Manager Handbook, and is intended to supplement IRM 1.4.1, Resource Guide for Managers, Management Roles and Responsibilities.
MATERIAL CHANGES

This IRM 1.4.24 incorporates interim guidance memorandums issued by the IRS Central Withholding Agreement (CWA) Program. See IRM 4.64.1.8.6, The Electronic Case File, which incorporates the guidance memorandum titled “Electronic Files - Procedures,” issued May 14, 2018.
This IRM supersedes IRM 1.4.24 dated July 17, 2017 and incorporates references to IRM
Large Business and International (LB&I) CWA Group Managers
Central Withholding Agreement Program Group Manager
Central Withholding Agreement Program Group Manager Handbook 1.4.24
A CWA group manager is responsible for developing employees and inventory management. Some areas requiring managerial involvement include:
See IRM 1.4.24.4, Data Gathering and Measurement (Reports).
(07-17-2017)ProgramManagementandReview

) A CWA group manager develops the expectation for the group in conjunction with the program manager. A CWA group manager and program manager will jointly identify opportunities, agree on goals, develop plans, and jointly reach commitments on those plans. These expectations should include the perfor- mance management objective in a CWA group manager’s performance plan. The CWA group manager will update and revise these expectations as program requirements change.

) Information obtained through the above reviews and visits must conform to requirements of Document
, National Agreement. (
) Reviews must be conducted for each employee. See IRM
, Resource Guide for Managers, Management Roles and Responsibilities. Feedback (

) The number of required formal written case reviews for each employee in Reviews group will be determined by the program manager, but at minimum, will provide enough documentation to support the employee’s midyear review annual appraisal. (
) Employees will be reviewed on critical job elements and tasks assigned. (
) Written documentation will be issued to employees. (
) Documentation will be completed for each employee within a group using a consistent format as determined by the program manager. (
) The CWA group manager will be available to meet with employees to all case reviews, midyear reviews and annual appraisals. (
) A CWA group manager must plan, monitor, and direct input of work to plish program priorities and effectively utilize resources. Management (

) The CWA group manager is responsible for reviewing and analyzing inventory to determine they are at appropriate levels. In addition, the CWA group manager is responsible for ensuring cases are closed timely. (
) The CWA group manager is responsible for reviewing ICS location codes sub codes to conﬁrm they are correct and updated timely. (

) A CWA group manager must work with other managers to balance between the groups. a. The CWA group manager will coordinate with other managers to cases from one group to another. b. When there is a change in staffing or other issues where inventory signments are affected, the CWA group manager will be responsible notifying the assignment “gatekeeper” to adjust the group assignment rotation schedule accordingly. (

) A CWA group manager must: • Assign work to maintain inventories to maximize efficiency, customer satisfaction, and business results • Anticipate and factor in other assignments such as employee on other program teams, lead development, acting assignments, or other temporary assignments • Monitor progress of open cases by reviewing ICS location codes ICS history • Guide employee performance by providing informal direction on prepare in-process case review when formal guidance is needed Internal Revenue Manual Cat. Note: Evaluative employee reviews or notations must not be written in the ICS history. • Conﬁrm employees follow procedural requirements (

) The CWA group manager will assign cases to the tax specialist or revenue agent. The CWA group manager will consider: Assignments a. Inventory Levels of the tax specialist or revenue agent to ensure inventory levels are maintained at maximum levels b. Knowledge of Tax Specialists/Revenue Agents and Complexity of Case when assigning a case to ensure the case is worked efficiently. CWA group manager should consider assigning cases based on mental needs of the tax specialists or revenue agents. (

) The CWA group manager is responsible for reviewing case inventory on and on the Electronic Case File server to ensure the cases reﬂect accurate Case Inventory entity detail, location codes, type of closure, CWA and Directed Withholding Systems (DWL) activity, and withholding amounts. (
) The CWA group manager will be actively involved in the progress of each ployee’s case work and ensure updates are timely and accurately made by employees. (

) The CWA group manager will review the CWA package for accuracy prior forwarding it to the program manager for review (if required) or approving Approvals execution where program manager review is not required. The CWA group manager will review: a. The budget to ensure proper budget analysis has been performed, all income items have been supported by proper documentation, and all expense items are treated properly for U.S. tax purposes. b. ICS to ensure it properly reﬂects all entity detail, includes all required history detail (including summary history), documents all contacts, all requested/received documents, the decisions of any determination by the tax specialist regarding the nonresident alien, budget, etc. c. All standardized documents related to the CWA to ensure they are accurate and supported by the information included in the budget and ICS history. (

) If there are questions or corrections, the CWA group manager will ICS. Once the case information is accurate, the CWA group manager will inform the tax specialist/revenue agent (or program manager if additional review is required). (
) The CWA will be approved and signed based on the current delegation (
) CWA group managers are responsible for considering and sending for manager approval addendum to CWAs. No.

1.4 Resource Guide for Managers
approved by the program manager. (

) If a request for an addendum is made by the NRA or authorized representative to add additional event(s) and the CWA has been executed, the addendum will be completed and reviewed and approved by the manager if documentation for the event(s) was provided at least
days before the ﬁrst event. Also, an addendum will be completed if the documentation for the event is provided with less than
days before the ﬁrst event but at least
days prior to the new event(s) to be included. This
day deadline applies to any event where notiﬁcation is provided less than
days before the ﬁrst CWA event. (

) If a request for an addendum is due to event(s) being cancelled, the manager will review and approve the addendum only if documentation to support that there will be no reimbursement or insurance claim with respect to that event(s)
(1) Manager must forward to program manager for approval all addendum not due to an event being added to the tour or an event being cancelled.

) The CWA group manager must approve any policy closures not due to where it is determined that the Non Resident Alien (NRA) is not performing, the entire tour is cancelled or the individual is a US resident or citizen based on a green card or passport, and document approval in the ICS case history. See IRM
, Policy Closure.
Streamline cases that become non
streamline cases
If a CWA was executed as a streamline case but at ﬁnal accounting meet the non
CWA streamline case criteria, the CWA group manager should review and approve the tax specialist’s ﬁnal accounting determination. Standard cases that become formal cases
If a CWA was executed as streamline or non
streamline case, but at ﬁnal accounting meets the formal case criteria, the CWA group manager should review and approve the ﬁnal accounting determination. Non Streamline or Formal Case
If a non
streamline or formal case has

Agreement Program Group Manager page review and approve the ﬁnal accounting determination. e. The CWA group manager may review the ﬁnal account when there are large, unusual and/or questionable items on the original budget that to be veriﬁed by ﬁnal accounting. f. The CWA group manager will review the ﬁnal accounting anytime the group manager has approved a CWA contingent on certain documents/ veriﬁcation being provided at ﬁnal accounting. g. The CWA group manager will notate in ICS when review of ﬁnal ing is required or completed. (

) The CWA group manager must approve all site visits prior to the event. a. The CWA group manager will require the request from the tax specialist to be in the standard format required by the program manager and include all required information. b. The CWA group manager will review and approve the request and forward the request to the program manager for ﬁnal approval. c. If a site visit is approved, the CWA group manager will ensure the site visit log is updated with the appropriate information. d. After the site visit is completed, the CWA group manager will ensure the tax specialist who conducted the site visit submits a site visit report within three business days of the site visit. The CWA group manager will review and approve the site visit report and forward it to the program manager. e. The CWA group manager will ensure the site visit log is updated with in- formation obtained at the site visit. The CWA group manager will submit the site visit log to the program analyst by the tenth business day of month. (
) The CWA group manager will ensure all cases are closed on ICS and from employee’s electronic case ﬁle view within
days of ﬁnal accounting letter if no additional deposits is required or within

days of the ﬁnal deposit being made if an additional deposit is required. This will be accomplished by the group manager copying the electronic case folder from the employee’s ECF folder of cases and pasting it in the GM’s “Closed Cases for GM” folder under the manager’s ECF view, followed by deleting the original ECF case ﬁle in the respective employee’s folder. The copy and paste method must be used by group manager instead of cutting or dragging the ECF ﬁle in order to retain different permission structures on the various levels/views of the electronic case ﬁle audit server. (

) The CWA group manager is responsible for assuring that control procedures are followed. As part of the month end closed case reconciliation, the GM, after reviewing the electronic case ﬁle for completeness, will copy and paste again, this time effectively moving the closed case(s) out to the ECF year folder associated with the event(s), as indicated in the last four digits of the case folder name. When sending a case to another specialist, post of duty, LB&I Quality Measurement System (LQMS), or repository case controls completing and tracking the Form
Document Transmittal.

1.4 Resource Guide for Managers

) The CWA group manager is responsible for reporting the accomplishments the group. The manager is responsible for maintaining employee reports and other databases the program uses to track results. As necessary, the CWA (Reports) group manager may conduct and/or participate in studies to help determine direction, expansion, or change in program activities. (

) The CWA group manager is responsible for reviewing the ICS location report to determine that progress is being made on each case and whether there is a need to provide guidance to resolve the case. (
) The CWA group manager will submit any additional report required by the program manager by the due date indicated in the request. (

) The CWA group manager will follow the instructions issued to prepare and up the monthly group report. In order to ensure the report is accurate, the Report CWA group manager must reconcile the tax specialist report. (
) The CWA group manager will discuss any discrepancies found during their review with the tax specialist to ensure the report is correct. (
) When the CWA group manager determines the report is accurate, the will be submitted with the program analyst, along with a count of the number full-time equivalents (TSRA and TE
’s) for the month. (
) The CWA group manager will submit the monthly report to the program by the
th business day following the end of the month. CWA employees complete input of their monthly report by the
th business day following the end of the month. Note: CWA employees cannot enter data into the current month until the has copied the prior month report and completed the group roll-up. (
) IRM

, The IRS Balanced Measurement System, provides guidance to prevent the use of statistics to: Data a. Evaluate employees, or b. Impose of suggest production quotas or goals with respect to such employees (

) CWA group managers are prohibited from using records of tax enforcement results (ROTERs) to evaluate any employee who exercises judgment with regard to determining tax liability or ability to pay. For more speciﬁc informa- tion, see IRM
, The IRS Balanced Measurement System and IRM Uses of Section
Statistics. (
) Interactions with taxpayers and their representatives must be conducted in a professional and competent manner. Satisfaction (

for guidance in dealing with taxpayers nated under the “Potentially Dangerous Taxpayer” (PDT) and “Caution Upon Dangerous Contact” (CAU) programs, respectively. Additional information can also be (PDT) and found on the Office of Employee Protection web site. Upon Contact Programs (
) Generally taxpayers dealing with the CWA program are represented by individual. (

) CWA group manager must effectively interact with taxpayers, and withholding agents. CWA group manager must maintain control over CWAs and decisions regarding withholding and not allow taxpayers, tatives, and withholding agents to attempt to stall progress, When and requested is not received by deadline provided by tax specialist, the group Agents manager should consider denying the CWA request. (

) When reviewing cases, the CWA group manager must conﬁrm that the tax specialist or revenue agent set reasonable deadlines and clariﬁed conse- quences for not meeting deadlines when requesting information and documents. (

) When the CWA group manager determines that a withholding agent has met the requirements outlined in the CWA, they should determine if the Agent holding agent should be placed on the “ineligible withholding agent” list. (

) If the CWA group manager determines that the withholding agent should be placed on the “ineligible withholding agent” list, the group manager will the request to the program manager for a ﬁnal determination.

1.4 Resource Guide for Managers

) Ensuring good customer relations with taxpayers is important. A group manager must listen to taxpayer concerns or complaints. Complex tax laws Concerns or and procedures are often the source of many concerns and complaints. A simple explanation or clariﬁcation is generally sufficient to resolve most concerns. (

) One of the group manager’s responsibilities is to facilitate discussions between employees and taxpayers. Let the taxpayer fully explain their Neither agree nor disagree with taxpayer until the employee has responded the taxpayer’s concerns. A group manager should avoid quick answers until they are in a position to make a fair and objective decision based on facts presented by all parties. After all the facts are determined, a group manager their employee should promptly respond to the taxpayer’s complaint or to the program manager. (
) The CWA e-mail box duties rotate between the CWA program groups. (
) The CWA group manager is responsible for assigning e-mail box duties for E-mail box month their group has mailbox duty. (

) A group manager is responsible for end-to-end management of the group. Some additional areas of responsibility include: Group a. Dissemination of instructions - a group manager should ensure Issues tions and guidelines from management are timely disseminated to the group. A group manager should meet with their group and discuss emerging issues, new developments, and revised procedures as warranted. b. Managerial Controls - a group manager should maintain effective group controls to ensure that work is assigned, worked in an efficient manner, and is complete. c. Access to tax administration tools - A group manager should ensure employees have access the tools to do their jobs. This may include but not limited to tax law research tools, E-mail, Internet research sites, CWA shared drive, and IDRS. (
) Employees may be granted access to IDRS as part of conducting research their assigned cases. Data Retrieval (
) The group manager is required to review IDRS usage report to ensure (IDRS)

Ensuring good customer relations with taxpayers is important. A group manager must listen to taxpayer concerns or complaints. Complex tax laws and procedures are often the source of many concerns and complaints. A simple explanation or clariﬁcation is generally sufficient to resolve most concerns.

One of the group manager’s responsibilities is to facilitate discussions between employees and taxpayers. Let the taxpayer fully explain their position. Neither agree nor disagree with taxpayer until the employee has responded to the taxpayer’s concerns. A group manager should avoid quick answers until they are in a position to make a fair and objective decision based on facts presented by all parties. After all the facts are determined, a group manager or their employee should promptly respond to the taxpayer’s complaint or elevate to the program manager.
Dissemination of instructions

a group manager should ensure tions and guidelines from management are timely disseminated to the group. A group manager should meet with their group and discuss emerging issues, new developments, and revised procedures as warranted. Managerial Controls
a group manager should maintain effective controls to ensure that work is assigned, worked in an efficient and is complete. Access to tax administration tools
A group manager should ensure employees have access the tools to do their jobs. This may include not limited to tax law research tools, E
mail, Internet research sites, CWA shared drive, and IDRS.
The group manager is required to review IDRS usage report to ensure employee access levels are appropriate and to report violations.
A CWA group manager will review and approve reported time in the Single Entry Time Recording (SETR).
